title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message:
Board had liquid damaged exclusively around U7100, cannot find evidence elsewhere.

Board gets orange and green lights on charger but not power on. PPBUS_G3H measures a fluctuating 3.9 - 4.1v, removed F7140 and PPVBAT_G3H_CHRG_REG measures the same fluctuation.

Changed U7100 numerous times, Q7130 and a bunch of resistors and caps that looked bad/measured out of spec.

U7100 readings:
Pin 19 - 5.5v
Pin 20 - 5.5v schematics say 5.1v here for pin 19 and 20
Pin 2 - 16.45v CHRG_DCIN
Pin 12 - 3.4v
Pin 3 - 4v
Pin 1 - 0v CHRG_AGATE at R7186 pin 1 measures 6.78v

I'm stuck, is the 5.5v at Pin 19/20 something to be concerned about as schematics say 5.1v
Why is R7186 got 6.78v at one side and not the other? It's a resistor which has been changed and measures 326k instead of 332k
What typically causes a voltage to fluctuate like that?

Thanks for the help

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: have you changed the current sense resistors?

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message:
Voltage on pin 2?
Resistance between pins 17/18?
Resistance between pins 27/28?

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: no I haven't but they are on system side aren't they?

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 33260"]Voltage on pin 2?
Resistance between pins 17/18?
Resistance between pins 27/28?[/QUOTE]

Pin 2 16.45v
3.9 ohms pin17/18
20.4 ohms Pin27/28

Which is correct from my understanding.

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: ok found sense resistors for charger, checked charger BMON current sense R5429 is 300k and R5439 AMON sense is 45.3k both read 0v

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: Remove F7140 to see if it is not the system pulling too much current.

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 33280"]Remove F7140 to see if it is not the system pulling too much current. [/QUOTE]

removed it sits at 4.8v

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: Issue must be around ISL6259 then. Voltage on R7120?

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: I figured the same and have stared at it and tested it for hours now.16.25v both sides

title: [SOLVED]820-3476 PPBUS_G3H = 4v
message: Bloody hell, just found R7125 was missing, not even there. I can't believe I missed it.. Put one on and I have 12.57v at F7140 now. Put back and we have fan spin and a Apple logo
